com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.util

Class ETLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.util.ETLogger

  • public class ETLogger
extends Object
    LogIt -- An overridden version of android.util.Log that will log based on how logging level is set within the SDK. Will ensure that sensitive data is removed before logging to logcat.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ETLogger getInstance()
        Getter method for the ETLogger singleton
        Returns:
        ETLogger

      • startCapture

        public boolean startCapture(android.content.Context context,
                   long maxMemorySize,
                   long maxFileSize,
                   boolean clearFile)
        Call this to start capturing SDK logs to memory.
        Parameters:
        context - To get application version info to add to log
        maxMemorySize - Maximum size in bytes to store in memory before being written to a file. Minimum is 4096.
        maxFileSize - Maximum size in bytes of the file before old entries are removed. Set to NO_FILE_LOGGING is you only want memory capture. If not NO_FILE_LOGGING, then must be equal to or larger than maxMemorySize, and at least 25000 bytes.
        clearFile - true to remove any existing file first. False to keep the file and append to it.
        Returns:
        boolean true if capture started. false if errors (check logcat)

      • stopCapture

        public void stopCapture()
        Call this to stop capturing SDK logs to memory. If you are also logging to file (as determined by startCapture(), then the memory will be flused to the file.

      • get

        public void get()
        Call this to stop capturing SDK logs to memory. If you are also logging to file (as determined by startCapture(), then the memory will be flused to the file.

      • isCaptureInProgress

        public boolean isCaptureInProgress()
        Call this to determine whether you are capture logs
        Returns:
        boolean true if capture is in progress, otherwise false

      • getInMemoryLog

        public StringBuilder getInMemoryLog()
        Call this to get the current log that is in memory
        Returns:
        StringBuilder current in memory log

      • getLogFilePath

        public String getLogFilePath(android.content.Context appContext)
        Call this to get the current log that is in memory
        Returns:
        String get absolute path of the current Log File

      • emailLogFile

        public boolean emailLogFile(android.app.Activity activity,
                   String[] toEmailAddresses,
                   String subject,
                   String body)
        Call this to format an email to send log file using an appropriate email on the device. A Chooser dialog from the Intent.ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE intents will be used to pop up a dialog to choose the correct email program to use.

        First the logfile will be copied from the internal storage to the Downloads folder for the device.

        Parameters:
        activity - Since an intent will be created, need an activity
        toEmailAddresses - A String[] containing the email addresses to send the log to
        subject - String containing the subject of the email
        body - String conatining the body of the email
        Returns:
        boolean true if chooser dialog created. false if errors (check logcat)
